intro: Tithymalus sanasunitensis, commonly known as the Sanasunitis tithymalus, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically features showy, daisy-like flowers with yellow centers and white to pale blue petals. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
